definition: lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
(negative prefix)/not/no
to know/to be aware
light/easy/gentle/soft/reckless/unimportant/frivolous/small in number/unstressed/neutral/to disparage
heavy/serious/to attach importance to
to repeat/repetition/again/re-/classifier: layer

sentences.english: These young people do not know the proper way to act.
sentences.chinese: 这些年轻人做事情不知轻重。

definition: inappropriate/bad-mannered
not knowing when to come or leave (idiom); with no sense of propriety
rude and impetuous
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
variant of 魯莽|鲁莽[lu3 mang3]
to fail to see the larger issue (idiom)/to fail to grasp the big picture
hasty/rash/impetuous
rash/impudent
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
not to know the immensity of heaven and earth/an exaggerated opinion of one's own abilities
pinyin: bu4 zhi1 tian1 gao1 di4 hou4

definition: to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
daring/presumptuous/daredevil
not understanding things (idiom); devoid of sense
to show no understanding of the times (idiom); cannot adapt to current circumstances/not amenable to reason
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
